Articles.Content:
Background: Remember your first spaceplane that flew? Yeah that one. With the delta wings and the oddly spaced engines. You got it to 200 m/s before it got too unstable to control. You eventually got a feel for making spaceplanes after that disaster. You've got your massive spacebus, the speedy jet, the maneuverable stuntplane... but the purpose doesn't matter - just how fast they go!

Challenge: Reach 1000 m/s with a spaceplane

Rules:

-Stock parts only

-Only use the air-breathing jet engines for propulsion

-Must launch horizontally

-Must break the 1000m/s barrier while maintaining relatively level flight (+/- 10 degrees from the horizon)

-No exploiting glitches or hax

Post a screenshot of how fast you got!

You really don't need all those engines, I got to 600+ m/s on my single-engined Azure KITE(available only at Golden Stingray Inc.).

Will get back to this one tomorrow after Summer Camp.

You really don't need all those engines, I got to 600+ m/s on my single-engined Azure KITE(available only at Golden Stingray Inc.).

Will get back to this one tomorrow after Summer Camp.

I started trying to hit 1000 m/s in my quad-engine. Here, I'll make a graph for you of my attempts...

My second try

I'm barely in level flight (-9deg) but at least no mech-jeb on board :3

Unfortunately as physics now stand drag is scaled by weight, so min fuel = best speed.

The challenge is interesting thou, i don't think true level flight (0+ deg) it would be easy, but there are better people than me on this forum who probably can do it with closed eyes and inverted

This is basically the Jet Engine Speed Challenge.

I haven't tried it again since 0.16 came out, but the physics of jet engines didn't change at all that I know of from 0.15.2 when I made that.

----

Ok, the jets haven't but the ability to hold together and steer that kind of craft definitely has. Redesigning now!

----

Gentlemen, I present to you the X-1 Speedy Gonzales!

Shortly after takeoff:

Nearly out of fuel but I made it in completely level flight:

I would say a better measure of "level flight" is less that 10 m/s on the vertical speed indicator.

Edited August 8, 2012 by khyron42

CHALLENGE ACCEPTED! (1025,6m/s)

The design was totally kerbal (just strap everything wherever) and it actually flew very straight and level without any input at 975m/s on maiden flight! I'm so proud of it =3
Made it after quite a few iterations... top speed: 1027m/s
Oh, dear. This is going to end up back at my 39-engine beast if it keeps going.
And even faster still (this time no mech jeb)...top speed: 1040m/s
I think true level flight is both at a pitch angle of +/- 10 degrees and a vertical speed of less than 10m/s (Nao both your craft are falling at more than 100m/s!!)

Dem Mexicans too fast. Really fun looking craft, needs a nosecone or sombrero.

Just made 1038,3 with 37 engines but it's over the limit of my old CPU, and it was at -6 deg attitude ... next time I'll try nice and level and post some pics .

edit:

upper picture: me sucking on keyboard flight - 1028,8 m/s level , lower: my CPU killer T_T -1038,3 m/s -7deg

cheers =3

Edited August 8, 2012 by Nao

This is the max I dare take this design, total of 37 engines, top speed of 1042 m/s

Pic of the craft shortly after running out of fuel

Evidence of top seed:
ok i got to 1032m/s using 8 engines but i used mech jeb will try later without mech jeb on will be posting pictures later

Oh, dear. This is going to end up back at my 39-engine beast if it keeps going.

I have to say khyron had this challenge licked when posted earlier in the Jet Engine Speed Challenge he mentioned. I managed to get within 10m/s or so of his speed but couldn't quite catch up. Good luck peeps!
if i said 6 engines i meant 7 and its imposible to fly without mech jeb
that is my flight

that is my flight
Could do that with my daedalus craft (It is in Orbit).
